title: Why so many people call bronze noob? well can i say gold is noob?
body:

well gold cant won platinum, how come i can won gold? im just a NOOB bronze :) this gold is telling me that cant won cait with a melee champion, that just lMAO, and , pro gold ? huh? i am mad when people say shi.t bronze cus some bronze much pro than him he just didnt see yet.{{champion:157}} dont ever look down bronze

replies.body: I'm not sure, but I THINK you're trying to use English right?
i know my english is not good but my main lanuage is not english , U ? whats ur main language ? english ? do u even know other languages?
lol My first language is Tagalog, which is the main language used in the Philippines. English is my second language, so yes, I know other languages.
well let the salt come out xD
play the man and not the ball. Criticise the content of the post instead.

I couldn't resist.. :/

On that note though, there's plenty to criticise there too

Dude, This is normals.

Normals is a place for people to try new things, Practice champs, play games drunk as fuck or even some other form of intoxicated.

Ranked is where you apply yourself, I have beaten a bunch of Platinums/Golds in Normals and i'm unranked.

This isnt saying i am good, this is saying that the Plats and Golds dont care as much about winning a normals game.
There are noobs in pretty much every rank bro, bronze just has more.

2/5 gold league trynd owned by cait so hard, the important thing is he telling me melee cant won cait? lol, and telling me no excuse when u lose ok? that is just Laugh my as.s off. what makes him that he can win me ? just because im bronze? lmao.{{champion:157}}

> [{quoted}](name=StoneaMeredithz,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Z0gOsL8t,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-11-29T05:56:01.701+0000)
>
> 2/5 gold league trynd owned by cait so hard, the important thing is he telling me melee cant won cait? lol, and telling me no excuse when u lose ok? that is just Laugh my as.s off. what makes him that he can win me ? just because im bronze? lmao.{{champion:157}}

If anyone can win anyone, they make a nice filler for your Xmas sack.

This sort of English is creeping throughout websites on the internet, just like the lose vs loose phenomenom that happened around the year 2000.

"..,the important thing is that he is telling me that a melee (champion) cannot win versus Caitlyn."

VERSUS being the key component of the sentence

"I won him" - and did he make a nice present for you? Trophy husband?

I WON VERSUS THEM

Please apply it correctly.
